overview: From 2026-02-13 to 2026-02-14, elizaos/eliza had 3 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: add Mint Club V2 plugin — bonding curve token trading on Base
topPRs.author: h1-hunt
topPRs.body:
## Summary Adds `@elizaos/plugin-mintclub` — a plugin for trading [Mint Club V2](https://mint.club) bonding curve tokens on Base. ## What it does Enables ElizaOS agents to: - **Query** token prices, info, and wallet balances - **Trade** bonding curve tokens with smart routing (auto-picks buy/sell/zap/swap) - **Swap** any token pair via Uniswap V3/V4 ## Actions | Action | Description | |--------|-------------| | `TOKEN_INFO` | Get token info (supply, reserve, price, bonding curve) | | `TOKEN_PRICE` | Get token price in reserve + USD | | `SWAP` | Smart swap — auto-routes via bonding curve or Uniswap | | `WALLET_BALANCE` | Show wallet address and balances | ## How it works Wraps the [`mint.club-cli`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mint.club-cli) (`mc` command) via shell execution. The CLI handles wallet management, auto routing, ERC-20 approvals, and transaction confirmation. ## Setup ```bash npm install -g mint.club-cli ``` Set `PRIVATE_KEY` in the agent's environment variables. ## Links - [Mint Club V2 Docs](https://docs.mint.club) - [CLI on npm](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mint.club-cli) - [MCP Server](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mintclub-mcp) - [Agent Skill on ClawHub](https://clawhub.com/skills/mintclub)

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

Adds `@elizaos/plugin-mintclub` plugin that wraps the `mint.club-cli` (`mc` command) to enable bonding curve token trading on Base. Provides 4 actions (TOKEN_INFO, TOKEN_PRICE, SWAP, WALLET_BALANCE) and 1 provider. **Critical Issues:** - Uses Node.js `execSync` from `child_process` which violates CRITICAL project rule requiring `Bun.spawn()` or `bun-exec` utility - Command injection vulnerability: user input (token names, amounts) inserted directly into shell commands without sanitization - Violates plugin architecture: external CLI should be wrapped in a Service class, not called directly from actions - WALLET_BALANCE action validates all messages (always returns true), will trigger on every user input **Architecture Issues:** - Missing Service layer for CLI integration - Fragile regex parsing for swap commands won't handle natural language variations - No tests included for security-critical code **Minor Issues:** - README recommends `npm` instead of required `bun` - Missing TypeScript devDependencies

Confidence Score: 1/5

- NOT safe to merge - contains critical security vulnerability and violates multiple project architectural rules - Score of 1 reflects: (1) command injection vulnerability allowing arbitrary shell execution, (2) violation of CRITICAL project rule against Node.js child_process APIs, (3) architectural violations requiring Service layer, (4) validation logic bug causing WALLET_BALANCE to trigger on all messages. These issues require immediate fixes before merge. - packages/plugin-mintclub/src/plugin.ts requires complete refactor to address security vulnerabilities, use Bun.spawn() instead of execSync, implement Service architecture, and fix validation logic

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/plugin-mintclub/src/plugin.ts | Uses Node.js child_process.execSync violating CRITICAL project rule requiring Bun.spawn(); command injection vulnerability in user input parsing; missing Service architecture; incorrect action validation logic | | packages/plugin-mintclub/package.json | Uses workspace:* correctly for @elizaos/core; missing devDependencies for TypeScript; peerDependency on CLI tool is unusual | | packages/plugin-mintclub/README.md | Clear documentation with setup instructions and examples |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant Agent participant Action participant execSync participant mc CLI participant Base Chain User->>Agent: "swap 100 from ETH to MINT" Agent->>Action: validate message Action->>Action: regex parse (from/to/amount) Agent->>Action: handler() Action->>execSync: mc swap -i ETH -o MINT -a 100 Note over execSync: ⚠️ Command injection risk
⚠️ Uses forbidden execSync execSync->>mc CLI: spawn process mc CLI->>mc CLI: load PRIVATE_KEY from env mc CLI->>Base Chain: execute swap transaction Base Chain-->>mc CLI: transaction result mc CLI-->>execSync: output text execSync-->>Action: result string Action->>User: callback with result text ``` Last reviewed commit: 351aed7 (3/5) Reply to the agent's comments like "Can you suggest a fix for this @greptileai?" or ask follow-up questions! **Context used:** - Context from `dashboard` - CLAUDE.md ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=8ef4c9a3-e221-4aef-8556-8c9b88bf6bbb)) - Context from `dashboard` - packages/plugin-starter/CLAUDE.md ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=7d041dea-d552-4802-9188-567d4fe8086b))

topPRs.title: build and local for chat example
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
> [!NOTE] > **Medium Risk** > Touches monorepo dependency management and adds/changes build tooling and dependencies, which can affect installs and CI; runtime code changes are mostly isolated to an example and type-only additions. > > **Overview** > The TypeScript chat example now supports **local LLM providers** (`@elizaos/plugin-ollama`, `@elizaos/plugin-local-ai`) with a two-pass provider selection: prefer explicitly configured env vars (API keys or local URLs), then auto-detect Ollama on localhost before falling back to cloud providers; messaging output was updated to separate local vs cloud setup guidance. > > Repo tooling is expanded with a new `scripts/fix-workspace-deps.mjs` and root `fix-deps` scripts to enforce/verify/restore `workspace:*` references across workspace packages, plus small build/dependency adjustments (use `bunx buf` for `generate:types`, add `@bufbuild/buf`, add several deps to `@elizaos/core`, bump `@pixi/react`, and minor TS/config/package.json cleanups including a `Character` type extension for `advancedPlanning`/`advancedMemory` and a couple import path fixes). > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit ff04809aef072c2ca92be9e903bda505472e8577. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds Ollama and local-ai support to the chat example with intelligent provider detection, and introduces a comprehensive workspace dependency management system. **Key Changes:** - **Chat example enhancements**: Added support for local LLM providers (Ollama, local-ai) with two-pass detection (explicit config → auto-detection fallback). The example now prioritizes local providers and auto-detects Ollama running on `localhost:11434`. - **Workspace dependency fixes**: New `fix-workspace-deps.mjs` script enforces `workspace:*` references across all 86 package.json files, preventing dependency loops and stale version issues in the monorepo. - **Type additions**: Added `advancedPlanning` and `advancedMemory` optional properties to the `Character` type. - **Import path corrections**: Fixed incorrect imports in `autonomy/service.ts` and `testing/index.ts`. - **Dependency additions**: Added missing dependencies (`drizzle-orm`, `esbuild`, `sharp`, `undici`, `yaml`) to typescript package. **Pattern Applied:** All plugin package.json files were updated to use `workspace:*` for internal dependencies (dependencies, devDependencies, and peerDependencies), with consistent formatting applied to arrays and objects.

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - The changes are well-structured and focused: (1) chat example improvements add valuable local LLM support with proper error handling and fallback logic, (2) the fix-workspace-deps.mjs script systematically addresses monorepo dependency management issues, (3) minor type additions and import fixes are straightforward, (4) all changes follow consistent patterns across 86 files without introducing breaking changes - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | examples/chat/typescript/chat.ts | Added Ollama and local-ai support with smart provider detection (explicit config → auto-detection fallback) | | examples/chat/typescript/package.json | Added plugin-ollama and plugin-local-ai dependencies using workspace:* | | scripts/fix-workspace-deps.mjs | New utility script to enforce workspace:* references across monorepo, preventing dependency loops | | packages/typescript/src/types/agent.ts | Added advancedPlanning and advancedMemory optional properties to Character type | | packages/typescript/package.json | Added missing dependencies: drizzle-orm, esbuild, sharp, undici, yaml | | package.json | Added fix-deps scripts and @bufbuild/buf dependency, updated generate:types to use bunx |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant ChatApp as chat.ts participant LoadLLM as loadLLMPlugin() participant Local as Local Providers participant Cloud as Cloud Providers User->>ChatApp: Start chat example ChatApp->>LoadLLM: Detect LLM provider Note over LoadLLM: Pass 1: Check explicit config LoadLLM->>Local: Check env vars (OLLAMA_API_URL, LOCAL_AI_URL) alt Local env var set Local->>LoadLLM: Ping detectUrl to verify server alt Server reachable LoadLLM->>Local: Load plugin Local-->>LoadLLM: Return plugin else Server not reachable Local-->>LoadLLM: Skip with warning end end LoadLLM->>Cloud: Check API keys (OPENAI_API_KEY, etc) alt API key found LoadLLM->>Cloud: Load plugin Cloud-->>LoadLLM: Return plugin end Note over LoadLLM: Pass 2: Auto-detect local servers alt No explicit config found LoadLLM->>Local: Ping localhost:11434 (Ollama) alt Ollama running LoadLLM->>Local: Load ollama plugin Local-->>LoadLLM: Return plugin end end LoadLLM-->>ChatApp: Return selected plugin ChatApp->>User: Start chat with detected provider ``` Last reviewed commit: 3839ed7

topPRs.title: feat: add Mint Club V2 plugin — bonding curve token trading on Base
topPRs.author: h1-hunt
topPRs.body:
## Summary Adds `@elizaos/plugin-mintclub` — a plugin for trading [Mint Club V2](https://mint.club) bonding curve tokens on Base. ## Changes Only adds `packages/plugin-mintclub/` (5 files) — no other changes. ## What it does Enables ElizaOS agents to: - **Query** token prices, info, and wallet balances - **Trade** bonding curve tokens with smart routing (auto-picks buy/sell/zap/swap) - **Swap** any token pair via Uniswap V3/V4 ## Actions | Action | Description | |--------|-------------| | `TOKEN_INFO` | Get token info (supply, reserve, price, bonding curve) | | `TOKEN_PRICE` | Get token price in reserve + USD | | `SWAP` | Smart swap — auto-routes via bonding curve or Uniswap | | `WALLET_BALANCE` | Show wallet address and balances | ## How it works Wraps the [`mint.club-cli`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mint.club-cli) (`mc` command) via shell execution. The CLI handles wallet management, auto routing, ERC-20 approvals, and transaction confirmation. ## Setup ```bash npm install -g mint.club-cli ``` Set `PRIVATE_KEY` in the agent's environment variables. ## Links - [Mint Club V2](https://mint.club) | [Docs](https://docs.mint.club) - [CLI on npm](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mint.club-cli) - [MCP Server](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mintclub-mcp) - [Agent Skill on ClawHub](https://clawhub.com/skills/mintclub)

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

Adds Mint Club V2 plugin enabling ElizaOS agents to trade bonding curve tokens on Base by wrapping the `mint.club-cli` (`mc` command) via shell execution. **Critical Issues Found:** - Uses banned `execSync` from `child_process` module (violates CLAUDE.md policy requiring `Bun.spawn()` or `bunExec()` utility) - Command injection vulnerability: concatenates unsanitized user input directly into shell commands without proper escaping - `WALLET_BALANCE` action's `validate()` returns `true` for all messages, triggering on unrelated user input **Other Issues:** - README instructs users to install with `npm` instead of project-required `bun` package manager **Positive Aspects:** - Correctly uses `workspace:*` for internal `@elizaos/core` dependency - Proper plugin structure with actions and provider - Clear documentation and examples

Confidence Score: 0/5

- This PR has critical security vulnerabilities and cannot be merged safely - Two critical issues block merging: (1) uses banned `execSync` API violating established project policy, and (2) command injection vulnerability allowing arbitrary code execution through malicious user input. The `WALLET_BALANCE` validation bug would trigger false positives. These must be resolved before merge. - Pay critical attention to `packages/plugin-mintclub/src/plugin.ts` - requires complete refactoring of command execution to use `bunExec()` with argument arrays

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/plugin-mintclub/src/plugin.ts | Critical security issues: uses banned `execSync` API and has command injection vulnerability from unsanitized user input. `WALLET_BALANCE` validate always returns true. | | packages/plugin-mintclub/README.md | Setup instructions use `npm` instead of required `bun` package manager |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant Agent participant Plugin participant CLI as mc CLI participant Base as Base Network User->>Agent: "Swap 100 from ETH to MINT" Agent->>Plugin: SWAP action handler Plugin->>Plugin: Parse input/output/amount from text Plugin->>Plugin: runMcCommand("mc swap -i ETH -o MINT -a 100") Plugin->>CLI: execSync shell command CLI->>CLI: Load wallet from PRIVATE_KEY CLI->>Base: Sign and submit transaction Base-->>CLI: Transaction result CLI-->>Plugin: Command output Plugin-->>Agent: ActionResult with text Agent-->>User: "Swapping 100 ETH to MINT..." ``` Last reviewed commit: f9c105e (4/5) You can add custom instructions or style guidelines for the agent [here](https://app.greptile.com/review/github)! **Context used:** - Context from `dashboard` - CLAUDE.md ([source](https://app.greptile.com/review/custom-context?memory=8ef4c9a3-e221-4aef-8556-8c9b88bf6bbb))
